content.question: An object is placed <math alttext="6.0 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>c</mi><mi>m</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> from a lens. The focal point of the lens is <math alttext="12 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>c</mi><mi>m</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> away from the lens. An image is produced that is <math alttext="12 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>c</mi><mi>m</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> away from the lens. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the lens is converging or diverging and whether the image is real or virtual?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
